dis: The idea of an open source community within an institution is itself so readily acceptable by everyone we have been talking to, why not just implement the same in actual? Just thought.
After working with a lot of professionals from not just from India but from around the planet, I realized the power of a community by actually being a part of one. Hence this.
Joining, learning, growing and now it's time for payback. This journey will always be incredible with ODC and its technically aligned members throughout the time.
Working around with different kinds of ML Algorithms and coming to an actual solution was almost impossible without having a community behind my back.
I've learned and gained experience in this field for the past 1 year. Though not a professional, but yes, enough to guide you throughout this journey in this field.
From learning core ECE subjects to developing technologies side by side, I have come a long way and it's the community that has held me back so far. So why not disseminate back to it?
Experience and exposure might look the same but are poles apart. After quite a long search for such a community, the Odyssey ends with this one.
Skillset & experience I possess not only shall bring value to me, but in turn would also help me help the younger ones. To help and share out knowledge, I joined ODC.
After working with a lot of professionals from not just from India but from around the planet, I realized the power of a community by actually being a part of one. Hence this.
